intro: Zwingera bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahian zwingera, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soil and full sunlight. Zwingera bahiensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
